Okay, to be fair that one actually makes sense.  >_>  

I know I may sound like an American that doesn't care about other regions' complaints, but equalizing the prices to reflect changes in global exchange rates is something that a lot of other businesses do.  Believe me, I hate a lot of Riot's decisions when it comes to their 'E-Commerce Department' (640 RP for a single ward skin?  Really?)  but there is no denying the fact that the Euro and the US Dollar have an exchange rate that is constantly in flux.  Prices for RP were set up at a time when the Dollar and the Euro (and by extension the AU and Canadian systems) were closer.  Right now regions that don't use the USD are getting more RP than those that do for what amounts to the same value in local currency.  

I am by no means an expert at economics, but the reason other regions' prices increased was because there was an imbalance and Riot's simply fixing things.  Their balance team could actually learn a lot from it...
